question: 口笛
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>mouth</kanji> <kanji>flute</kanji>... Normal flutes you blow air through to make a sound. How do you blow air through your mouth to make a sound? By <vocabulary>whistling</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the kun'yomi readings put together. Thank <ja>口</ja> for being a body part, which tends to cause this to happen. So, you have <ja>口</ja> (<ja>くち</ja>) and <ja>笛</ja> (<ja>ふえ</ja>) put together, though <ja>ふえ</ja> changes to <ja>ぶえ</ja>, maybe because you can't whistle properly? Buuuweeee. Buwwweee.
